cont.entity_a: The card does not work on RedHat 5.5 or Xubuntu 9.04 Linux.
cont.entity_b: Linksys WPC54GX4 is very compatible with Linksys wireless router.

cont.entity_a: Drivers from Trendnet and Ralink produce errors.
Reliable network card with good range. Loses connection frequently even when close to the router. This card has stability problems and often disconnects.
cont.entity_b: No connection problems on any floor of the house.

cont.entity_a: Supports the latest and most secure encryption methods.
Installation was quick and easy on both Windows XP and uBuntu 9.0.4. Installation was quick with CD.
cont.entity_b: Lynksys was easy to install and set up. Setup and installation were seamless. Setup was easy and straightforward.

cont.entity_a: Fairly priced. Price at 'new ovum' was double compared to Amazon.
cont.entity_b: Price is great. Purchased for a fraction of the local price.

cont.entity_a: TrendNet's customer service is very good.
Not faster in N-mode than Cisco in G-mode. Transmission speed says 170-230mbs vs Cisco 54mbs, but actual speeds are less. Connection is superb at the max rate.
cont.entity_b: Works well with both work and home computers. Does a good job overall for older laptops. Worked for 1 week, then caused computer freeze issues.

cont.entity_a: Worst range experienced compared to older cards.
cont.entity_b: Range is not better than other adapters. Range and coverage are excellent. Improved range compared to previous 6-year-old Linksys card. Range is good, picked up signals over a block away. Linksys card had better range and signal strength than internal wireless. Better range and signal strength than the internal wireless card.

cont.entity_a: Management software did not work on XP; had to use XP to manage the card.
cont.entity_b: Software is fast and easy, scans for networks quickly. Bothersome dialog box appears when not attached to work computer.

cont.entity_a: Replaced a bulky USB wireless connector.
cont.entity_b: Construction is better than previous unit.
